ygData.subject: Re: Supporting yourself
ygData.msgSnippet: ah but the important part is the wings stack.  beetle eyes take up LOTS of space although they are good sources of income.  Also, not sure if wasps and beetles
ygData.messageBody:
ah but the important part is the wings stack. beetle eyes take up LOTS
of space although they are good sources of income. Also, not sure if
wasps and beetles in same areas anyway. My main point was find stuff
that is plentiful and gives stackable loot that sells for a decent
amount. Anyone know other creatures with stackable loot in other parts
of the world?

-----Original Message-----
From: David Long [mailto:dplong@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 4:54 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Supporting yourself


From: "David Long" <dplong@...>

only one silver ??? ouchie . fire beetle eyes for for 2s2c and there
legs 1s and ther are a weak creature only problem they are in nekios
forest (cant remeber the spelling id i got it worng) only problem the
guards dont like many non Teir'Dal 's

>>> Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...> 04/20 2:12 PM >>>
From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>

hunt giant wasps - 1 silver per wing. carry like 40 before selling.
that's 4 gold

hunt pawns - weapons and cloth armor sell for 1+ gold ea. I made 6 plat
in a long (8 hour day) of playing. Cracked staffs go for over 1 plat!

group and hunt bigger orcs - exp for yellow stuff and share the loot

As a level 9 necro on other char I help successfully take down wisps.
Our enchanter pets can hit wisps (pretty well) by the way. The trick is
having a tank that can take the damage while we chip away at the wisp.

Azara
level 6 high elf enchantress

-----Original Message-----
From: Miller, Keith A. [mailto:keithm@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 7:01 AM
To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Supporting yourself


From: "Miller, Keith A." <keithm@...>

There is not much you can do to make money until you hit 12 or so. At
that point you can hunt wisps or bandit camps, both of which are
potentially very rewarding.

-----Original Message-----
From: clark@... [mailto:clark@...]
Sent: Monday, April 19, 1999 3:44 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: [eqenchanters] Supporting yourself


From: clark@...

Greetings I am Ageron Gnome Enchanter. I am very fond of my chosen
profession, and hope to start jewlery craft soon. I find it almost
impossible to make enough coin to buy my 8th level spells, and I hear
Learning to make Jewlery is very expensive. It sounds like some
enchanters out there have coins to spare. Can I ask how you are
generating money? What creatures are you slaying to support yourselves?

Thank you

Ageron of Tunare
